data.influencer-search#Influencer Search: Use this application to search through our database of previously activated creators

data: Ibex User documentationThis document provides a comprehensive guide to using the Ibex dashboard located at https://ibex.goatagency.com/dashboard. It covers key features, functionalities, and common workflows to help you effectively manage your campaigns and data.
data.1-getting-started#1. Getting Started:
Logging In: Access the Ibex dashboard by navigating to https://ibex.goatagency.com/dashboard in your web browser. Enter your provided username and password, then click "Login". Contact your administrator if you have forgotten your credentials.
Dashboard Overview: Upon successful login, you'll be presented with the main dashboard. This provides a high-level overview of your key metrics and campaign performance. Familiarize yourself with the layout and available information.
data.why-use-nextra#Why use Nextra?:
The main reason to use Nextra and MDX for the Ibex User documentation instead of tools
like Notion, which we use for other purposes, is the support of React
components inside our Markdown files. This allows us to create custom components that are specific to our documentation.At the same time we are still writing in Markdown which allows us to migrate everything to Notion
easily, albeit with some loss of functionality.Also, everything is save in a github repository, so we can easily make changes
and collaborate on the documentation.
